mPXfiFVDOEGg190HADsSiw.text: We've been waiting for this place to open up for almost 2 years now. We actually thought it was closed before it opened until finally we saw a new sign posted. Since we worked around the block, we thought we'd try it out for brunch.   We ordered a few items from the menu: !) 2 eggs, 2) omelette, and 3) pancakes with sausage.   we all agreed that we could all have made the 2 eggs dish. Nothing was special here. perhaps the special salt rising bread? but to no avail.  Everything seemed a bit underwhelming. Perhaps we had too high of expectations. The mujadara with rice was flavorful but it wasn't "I want more of it" good.  The omelette was fancy with special ingredients like radishes and asparagus. The pancakes were just average. Wish they could have done something a little special with the butter or in the batter.   We ordered the vinegar pie in the end. we didn't have a taste for rhubarb and wanted to taste the vinegar pie that tasted like an apple pie.  Not too many pie choices for a place called pie for breakfast, but it made do. It was tart at first bite but sweet in the end. Not too bad, but for $4.50 a slice?   If I were to give it a rating, I'd give it 2.5 stars. Priced a bit high for the amount of food.   You can definitely do better at Pamelas and at Square Cafe for breakfast/brunch options.

0GT05zoOujE7Bl2h3NjoJQ.text: I'm living nearby this place so have visited this place quite many times. However I decided not to go anymore. The food is pricey considering the portions and quality. But what made me stop ordering food here is their awful service. They deliverately discriminate people - by only caring their regular. I got literally a half portion of fries and way more tiny chunk of ham compared to the frequenter right next to me. Never visit here unless you're willing to open your wallet only for them.

C_99XUc1r1Sulvk0F4Pf7g.text: I discovered Pie for Breakfast after they donated pies to Pitt's Psychology Club event. I never thought I would like a vinegar pie but it is soooo good omg

P_MIGToB881IUVIozx92jg.text: I got the omelette with Swiss, asparagus, and ham and it was okay but definitely not the best it could be for $10. The salt rising bread toast was a single piece of toast which was kind of small from what I had imagined prior. The omelette tasted very buttery and the toast was also covered in butter. The omelette was tasty but I think there was a bit too much butter. They seem to be a little stingy on their serving sizes; my friend ordered the two eggs, toast, and potatoes breakfast and there were very little potatoes and a single slice of toast. The toast wasn't bad, it was pretty dense and nicely toasted. However, overall I thought it was slightly overpriced for the quantity of food they gave us. Also, i asked if i could substitute my Swiss cheese with any other cheese and they said they only had Swiss available (surprised about this!) But, my other friend got the buttermilk pancakes and they were really delicious--light, fluffy, and tasty! I think out of the 3 different meals at the table, the pancakes were the best.

photos.caption: Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Omelette with Asparagus, Ham, and Swiss.

lfztQdYj-64A8em41XeRZQ.text: Me and friends came for breakfast on a Saturday. We were so excited for this place, and thought they'll have lots of cool pie for breakfast. Surprisingly, they only had three pies, vinegar, chocolate moose, and peach cream. We tried the vinegar and peach cream, they're good but not outstanding. The food option was also very limited. Some restaurants give you small selection of food so everything you order is amazing, but this place was kind of disappointing. I got kale Swiss quiche for my breakfast entree, it was good but I had better for sure.  The service was NOT on point. The waitress did not check on us often, six of us were out of water for awhile. We also weren't given enough glass for water. Two of us had to share one water glass for awhile, because the waitress kept forgetting to bring us one more glass. On top of that, my boyfriend got an omelette and toast, it was very basic. It didn't come with much stuff, the omelette was mediocre and the toast was very plain. They did not give any jelly or jam, so he asked for it. In the end, they charged us the jam AND they would not let us use more than two credit cards, for six people. Probably won't come back again.

TP0uivz0qKLJ5pf0vTgbxg.text: I've been here three times now for lunch. I love the simplicity of their food offerings and the flavors. I've tried the pork chop, meatloaf, chicken & biscuits, pancakes, and the mujadara, greens, and beet sides. The salt rising bread is a great compliment to their offerings. The only pie I've tried is the vinegar pie, which is definitely one reserved for hardcore sweet lovers. It's very sweet, and not something that I would order again. I would love to try their other pie offerings sometime. The coffee is pretty decent, and service is always good. Everything is tasty and fresh, and I love that they use local ingredients whenever they can. It's a favorite spot of mine to catch up with friends and enjoy a good meal.

O8-0_MhI3yzwME5W86TQGg.text: Delicious delicious delicious. They have vegetarian mushroom gravy & biscuits. The pie isn't vegetarian. Chocolate chips are vegetarian. Very fun atmosphere, a little wait, but it wasn't too bad. They haven't finalized the menu yet, but are supposed to soon.   They aren't on no wait, but are looking into it.

DtuDEt5qu0PPTz2ocxwHFA.text: I really enjoyed Pie for Breakfast! Small little bustling diner/cafe'. While I did not get to actually eat pie for breakfast (as there were no seasonal fruit pies available when I went) the food that I did taste was well prepared, fresh and hot. I ordered the avocado and bacon omlette, while my partner had the house cured keilbasa and eggs. He raved that this was some of the best smoked sausage he's ever tasted! (And trust me he knows meats!) Both breakfasts were accompanied by a thick slice of home made toast, and I opted for a side of cheesy grits to taste as well. I will definitely be back for some of the house made biscuits, and the braised greens which not only looked and smelled amazing, but were lauded by the friendly staff! If you're in the market for a fresh, unique and tasty take on breakfast you definitely should try some Pie for Breakfast!

xDVXxFsDx3Qo_zcJXZRlmg.text: I love this place. Both times that I've been there I've had their omelette of the day, one with kimchi and another with ham and shishito peppers, and both were DELICIOUS! They also serve this yummy salt bread that they bake fresh. I've also tried their pie, and am in love with the peanut butter pie! Their coffee is good too. I think their prices are very reasonable for the quality of food, and the staff is very friendly and upbeat. I always enjoy the food and the experience at Pie for Breakfast. I highly recommend trying this pace!

tof_2LDM1pn4YYZPX2e1hg.text: It was wonderful. I think we went on the day of the grand opening. The place was crowded but the service was warm and friendly. My son had eggs, home fries, cottage bacon and home made bread/toast. The bacon was special as was the home made bread/toast. The eggs were buttery and delicious. I had the salad with house made vinaigrette. It had mixed greens, asparagus and lentils. The asparagus was perfectly cooked. I added the arctic char on top which again was well cooked with a crispy skin. All in all a wonderful lunch. We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Salad with arctic char
Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Eggs, home fries, cottage bacon and toast
Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

7U9SyUXyNHp_0QK37CIR_g.text: In town for a short visit, we looked forward to trying a new breakfast place based on great reviews. Major disappointment. Ordered toast, polish sausage omelet & potatoes. Vegan daughter requested butter on the side - which was not honored. In fact, all our food was slathered in a greasy, buttery(?) mess. It tasted horrible.

ToI4RQUIX860NU7zWSlDMg.text: It's fine, I guess. The kimchi omelette I had was delicious, but nothing else warranted the price. The decor is lovely, and the pie crust is great, but the vinegar pie I had was too sweet to finish, and my boyfriend was disappointed with his breakfast.

Z2NYrns3IBE_doKc35P4dg.text: Great pies! Haven't try pie with these flavor (vinegar, rhubarb)! Can't wait for the full menu next week

photos.caption: Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

izv1nsQ7buTEwcPThJg_oQ.text: Very good food. The pie is fantastic. Order a small breakfast and get pie instead. Sourdough toast is fine but not as good as the reviews I read suggested.

Wk3d1-hwHUzhid6l6NgRbA.text: Super cute hipster breakfast spot. Yummy sausage biscuits and gravy. Delicious fresh baked toast. The coffee...wow. The service was a little awkward. Can a girl get a refill on coffee please? Got some apple pie to go and warmed it up later with ice cream. Delicious. I'll be back again for sure

TS4M5X7cajxE9kpsWAuofg.text: I just really love this place. Good, hardy and consistent breakfast. The pie is delish as well!

vaikUXT7clbACvHdS3-BIg.text: So thankful for this new after work spot. Dinner/drinks till 9pm most days is perfect. Great place to stop after work before heading home. Tables booths and a nice high top bar with stools.  Good music, but not too loud, great place for conversation.  Food is fresh and comforting.  Great basic bar with top shelf and prosecco on tap.  I def would recommend it!

photos.caption: Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Arctic char with mango salsa, cornbread muffin, broccolini, rice pilaf.  YUM! Prosecco on tap!

kAiHw8wxUibT8ntv_gO5cQ.text: This might be my new favorite breakfast place in Pittsburgh. The pork chop is one of the best I've had anywhere despite being thin dinner cut

gsQcJJHj7iZJKSy9qSGq2Q.text: I just don't understand why everything must be burned.  Burned eggs, burned quiche, burned biscuits, and yes, burned pie.  I don't think it was an off day because even the food photos in their website are burned.  The bread, even if not completely burned, is inedible. Like something you would be served in a gulag.  The Bloody Mary is just indescribably weird. Not drinkable. However, I must say the wait staff is very helpful and attentive.  They are why this review is one star and not zero.

VdmFhREjanfiRnkPVXQ4ew.text: Last time i came over, our party of two waited for more than an hour to he seated, and the place closes around 2pm over the weekend. I would try to arrive around 11:30 so that theres enough time to finish our food.

TkQqjGx4P729HMbmxkGb-Q.text: What a friendly place! What a delicious meal!   This is a busy place for breakfast! But we took advantage of the first-come first-serve seating at the bar and I'm so glad we did! First, the bar has purse hooks(!!! Why don't ALL bars?) and the seats were very comfortable with nice back support! The stainless steel counter/bar was nice and big and super clean! The service was excellent! They glided back and forth taking care of everybody, chiming in on conversations when they heard somebody inquiring about something without being intrusive, they were happy to talk about their MANY local items on the food menu and drink menu! They just couldn't have been nicer!  The food...oh my...I had scrambled eggs, subbed grits for home fries and added greens on the side! Heavenly! I said I'd get it again and I didn't even need the eggs, but they were so good (LOCAL) I'm glad I got them! Even the toast was excellent! It's their own salt rising bread!  We had such a nice time that we wanted to sit and chat and drink coffee, but, alas, there were hungry people waiting for seats!   We'll be back for PIE!

photos.caption: Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

am8ECMoX2Ezc1eGH6Ha2PQ.text: Breakfast here was so good. I got the potato, leek, and goat cheese quiche with a side of home fries. The quiche was the perfect portion and so tasty. The home fries were crispy and the best I've had out of my breakfasts on vacation. My boyfriend got eggs, sausage, and grits. The grits were buttery and cheesy. The sausage was really high quality and did not seem pre packaged. We also got rhubarb pie because the place is called Pie for Breakfast! No regrets there.

photos.caption: Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Rhubarb pie, eggs, grits, and sausage
Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Quiche and home fries

BTkNFdCDmYFw9rP7V5bfOg.text: I had the two eggs (scrambled) and salt rising bread toast with mujadara and pork sausage. While I was surprised to see the mujadara with rice rather than bulgur wheat, it was very very good. The eggs were great. The sausage was great. The mujadara was yummy. The toast was perhaps the most perfect toast I have ever had in my life.  After, I shared a piece of the peach-berry pie, and that was wonderful as well.  My only regret is that I no longer live upstairs, but am visiting from out of town. I will certainly be back whenever I visit Pittsburgh in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

FQk73aDUmGhQax3lA-cg2w.text: What an interesting experience. If you enjoy good food while elbowing the strangers at the table next to you, this is the place for you. This was my first experience here and I was taken aback by some of the shortcomings of this place. The dining room is crammed with tables which means if you get lucky, you get to be in the middle of multiple conversations. In fact, it is so loud my friend and I ended up not talking to each other for most of the meal because we couldn't hear each other.  The food was good but choices were limited. The server informed us that limited substitutions and changes were allowed. The pie varieties were unique and offered us the opportunity to try a couple pies that you won't find at most bakeries or eat n park.  Though the server was nice, the coffee was lacking. There was an abundance of coffee grounds in the cup which left a bad taste in our mouths.  All that being said, we aren't opposed to returning but will consider other options in the area first.

photos.caption: Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

hyGoowBV6Xwb-NUtOvvbGQ.text: First of all, Pie for Breakfast had generally good food. We had biscuits that were perfectly cooked to a golden brown and covered in luscious mushroom gravy. We also ordered eggs that were exactly over medium and flavorful breakfast potatoes. The vinegar pie was sweet, interesting, and satisfying.  Even though the food is good, it is highly unlikely that I will ever return to Pie for Breakfast. We started the morning by adding ourselves to the No Wait app. It said to check in prior to 10:05am. We arrived at 9:50am and told the hostess that we were here and the other two party members were about to arrive as well. She said we were just waiting for a table to pay and then we would be seated.   10 minutes later I asked about the status of our table and she said a few more minutes. 10 minutes later another member of our party asked what was going on. Hostess says she didn't realize our party was here and gave our table away. She isn't sure how long it will take to get us a table at this point. She offers us coffee after another member of our party speaks to her. She seemed stressed, unapologetic, and didn't seem to have any interest in communicating what the heck is happening with our table unless we continually go up to her to ask.  Almost an hour after arriving, and over an hour and a half of placing our names on the no wait app, we are finally seated. We wait and wait, hoping to get cream and sugar for our coffee. After waiting almost 10 minutes I grab a container of cream and silverware off of a stand near our table. The server finally appears and we  finally order. He's nice and it seems like our visit is finally improving. The food arrives over a period of 15 minute. Multiple items are forgotten and we keep having to ask for the different items we ordered. Portions are shamefully small. Our $3.50 potato side was given to us in a ramekin that could have been used for condiments. The salt toast is boring and feels like it needs... salt...   We have concerns with the check and they fix it right away. Nothing was good enough to go back for and it definitely wasn't worth the money or time we spent. I've heard others have better experiences with service and seating, but I can get the same quality of breakfast food at many other places for less money.

0D49nUYH0K88qTBW3R_IRw.text: Can't believe it took me so long to check this place out! I live a couple blocks away and I decided to check it out this morning. The restaurant was pretty busy but the food came out quick! The eggs were delicious and dippy, the bacon was crispy and not overly fatty. The salt rising bread was crunchy and the cheesy grits were amazing! I ended my meal with a slice of vinegar pie which was an interesting taste but I enjoyed it. All in all this is probably my new favorite breakfast place in Oakland. Will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fried eggs slightly dippy, bacon, salt rising bread, and cheesy grits with a chai latte. Delicious!

9hLMQFuQ5_xSIz5aWoS7Pg.text: I've been here twice, and I can say I really enjoyed both pies. The prices are almost fair. The pies do not come with whipped cream. This is definitely surprising and not great. For example, if you order peanut butter or cookies & cream or chocolate pie, you need an unsweetened or slightly sweetened whipped cream to balance out the rich taste of peanut butter or chocolate. The first time I got a fruit pie. Second time peanut butter. I felt desperate for milk or something by the end. Not a pie place to me if you can't even provide something to balance out the taste! Even a fruit pie that is too Tarty based on the season and ripeness of the fruit needs something to calm the tartiness down like whipped cream or ice cream.. hope they implement it!

photos.caption: Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

HEWuqFtymcob0AfE-0xgMw.text: Super cute atmosphere!! The quiche was fantastic, they kept the coffee coming too which is wonderful for a hangover. Will definitely return to try *everything* else on the menu

zLsOCBSjd9iwyNj6HLscHw.text: I don't think I can actually star this. After calling on Easter and getting a message that they do carry out and are open all year, I drive down only to be told they are only doing pie and coffee to go today.  No sorry.  No attempt to make it right. A complete waste of time, energy, and parking (which isn't easy to do in this area really).

sY28ZIvw6QwxjAywZZC9Eg.text: This place was packed and for good reason!  We were put on a waitlist which they accurately estimated to be 25-30 minutes. It's great that they go through yelp, as you can track where you are in line. When we were seated we were promptly served.   We each ordered the 2 eggs with home fries, salt raised bread, and bacon / ham, and everything was absolutely delicious. The home fries were appropriately seasoned and flavorful, the bacon was great. The ham was interesting, it was a thick cut and tasted closer to a pork chop than anything.   For the titular item, we ordered the vinegar pie and pear pie, which blew us away. Vinegar pie had a great apple cider flavor and sugar crust, it was very sweet. Pear pie I thought was perfect, soft, a light sweetness, flaky oat crust.

Ox5_MyCLgwrADwcG1cMwFQ.text: What a great little place!  I wish I lived in Pittsburgh so I could visit it frequently.    However, I found myself having breakfast there. It's quirky, with a clean and modern look.  It's comfortable and the service was friendly, attentive and informed.  But the food was the thing.    I had the Buttermilk Pancakes, with real maple syrup and a side of bacon.  The cakes were unusually flavorful, tasty, hot and fresh. The bacon was meaty.  The latte was delicious.  My dining companion had the Rhubarb Pie, which also was surprising in its subtly delicious tastiness. It wasn't too sweet, just enough, while definitely being scrumptiously pie-ish.  Words fail, apparently, when confronted with actual flavorful food. There were a bunch of other interesting options that i bet would be great too - choices that intrigued.  I look forward to my next visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

YyS4hZi1_5LuSNooRsGtxA.text: We stopped on a Saturday around noon, so we were expecting a wait. Love that they use the waitlist through yelp because we were able to leave and walk around for about an 45 mins. It made the time fly!   Staff was very friendly.  Food was delicious. Atmosphere was perfect.  We will be back. Oh and thank you for the delicious peanut butter pie. it was so light and fluffy!

P9TioKj6uIZoCwJbwWMLYQ.text: I wanted to wait until trying this place more than once to review due to the various factors affecting the overall experience.   While the menu seems to favor bar drinks over brunch, there are some curious specials thrown in with a la carte brunch staples. Some of these include meatloaf and pork chops alongside omelettes and quiche. On top of this, the interior is very minimalist and largely inoffensive, which leaves the experience up to interpretation.   My girlfriend and I were told 20-30 minutes and ended up waiting 50, while some other couples coming in later took spots at the bar and windows (these were offered to them by the hostess instead of those already waiting, although it is first come first serve). Overall, the breakfast food is very standard and accessible. The home fries are flavorful with some hot sauce, and the solo slice of toast was nice and thick.   I would strongly recommend actually ordering a slice of pie (particularly peanut butter), as this was by far the highlight of our meal. Only a small piece of the menu is dedicated to this namesake item, and I truly believe they would benefit from expanding the selection - at least for weekend brunch.

E4Mv0SxSG08OqHbeaf-N-A.text: Loved my dining experience here. The service was friendly and the food delish. I had the omelette and my friend had the salad. Then we indulged in desert. The cc cookie was perfect but the cookies n cream pie was to die for !

jQ-ixYnN0QnNB2m6YHxhmQ.text: Been here four times now. Still like their food, but the wait time only gets worse. Sometimes we were seated for 15 mins and there's no one serving us. I had to grab water and a waitress by myself.  However, their menu does change regularly, and it seems we can join wait list on Yelp before coming.

tlO5VvESisLA8OXKhftsPg.text: I'm a huge fan of brunch! I don't mind waiting for great service and food. I'm not concerned with price, as long as the quality is great. The staff were pretentious and snarky!  I had two eggs, home fries, sausage, grits, and greens. My food was presented well. The grits lacked salt/flavor. The greens had a strong vinegar base! Home fries and eggs were decent. The coffee passable. Overall, I found myself struggling to finish my meal - the service really lessened the experience too.

wUGYHI4MQ_vIxQ4Iv-dC-A.text: Excellent diner. There is almost always a wait but their service is fast and it won't take long. Everything is made from scratch and it feels like your favorite diner from when you were a kid. The menus is fairly limited but everything is excellent. Their portions are on the larger side, which you'll want to remember so you can save room for their pie. The pies will remind you of your grandma's. They're one of the few places who get the crust right: it's never soggy nor is it so thick you can't bite it. Try the vinegar pie. I know it sounds weird but just try it. It's like an apple pie without the apples. Seriously, try it.

IFrh_d_VrMKNsdK8X9Frbg.text: The food is great but they have to find a way to handle the seating.  It's ridiculous. We have been multiple times.  When there's a line you have to track down someone to give them your name.  Today we waited 40 minutes (still waiting as I type this). We told the host that we would take bar or table and he said he'd let us know. Two seats opened up at the bar and a couple walked by us and took them before the couple leaving put their coats on.  The host did nothing to stop them.  We then watched several parties of three and four who came in after us get seated because they save the booths for 3 or more.  So my party of two is still standing her (probably 45 minutes now) waiting for a two top or seats at the bar.  The food is good...but the service is rude and it's probably not worth the wait.  We'll be leaving without lunch :(.

ozNST0lupPKBl4Y5pFXpQg.text: Definitely going to be my new go-to place! I came for dinner on opening day and opted for 4 different sides: mashed potatoes, broccoli, cornbread muffin, and black eyed peas. All were delicious and tasted just like home! Seriously-the mashed potatoes tasted exactly like my grandmas.   Service was awesome too. Everyone kept checking in on us since it was opening day. For dessert I went for the lemon-rose cookie and coffee. Yum! The cookie was so fluffy and delicious. Can't say enough good things about this place. Cannot wait to come back for breakfast!

aK-kUPea2ChjDSj2gvlKcw.text: I've meaning to visit this place for a while since it is a minute walk from my place. My friend and I went for Saturday brunch and place was pretty packed. We put our name on the waitlist and waited for about 10min. We sat at the bar side and I got a quiche with side salad and iced latte and my friend got biscuit with gravy & blueberry quiche. Both were delicious and the portion was just about right. However, most of the menu were things you could easily make at home. If you want a little break from cooking food on the weekend then I would recommend this place. Food came out quickly too.

photos.caption: Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bacon quiche with side salad

X8VAr_GNE4N1hD8k7zN6rg.text: Slow service, probably because it's a new place. Had the home fries which were good. Sausage was not great. Pretty limited menu, nothing really too special.

9A9uIiDAjWVsDjRi1TpxCg.text: We visited PFB this morning looking for a different twist on our Sunday brunch.  Arriving close to noon, we were told that our wait for a table would be more than 30 minutes.  The seating area is quite small, so we weren't surprised at the wait time.  We were seated at the bar/counter after about 45 minutes waiting.  The staff is friendly, and were very attentive.  Our orders were simple, coffees, scrabbled eggs, bacon, and the omelette special.  The coffee was unremarkable, other than the scalding temperature, which made it impossible to drink (I still have a blister on the roof of my mouth from sip one).  Administration of ice dropped the temperature to endurable levels.  The omelette was delicious, though not a True omelette, more a grilled flat egg wrapped around the pepper and mushroom contents.  The best part of the omelette, however, was the superb slice of white bread toast homemade in situ.  The toast taste was memorable.  The scrambled eggs were laughable, appearing unadorned on a small plate with the bacon.  It looked a bit like someone's last meal.  The price for our meal was far too much for the meager offerings... over $30 for 2 coffees, an omelette, and the mere suggestion of eggs and bacon.  Wait time...D; food quality...A (and cool down the coffee, please), value...C.  We will not likely return.

CnNOfJwg43wzeR_UWw39yQ.text: We went right after opening so this review might be biased by that fact. We had a decent time and enjoyed the casual, relaxed atmosphere. I had the pork chop with mashed potatoes and cornbread. My wife had the char. We both enjoyed our meals. My pork was quite tasty, however a tad overcooked and chewy. The mashed potatoes were salted just a little too heavily, but otherwise were good. My favorite part of the meal was the cornbread muffin. The service was a little spotty -- friendly staff, but it felt as though the staff were still adjusting to the location and were not yet fully comfortable with the menu and the mood of the place, so that affected the service a bit. We also had the rhubarb pie, which was superb. Overall, I'd give this place a 3/5, keeping in mind that the quality will probably rise as the restaurant ages. I will definitely return once the restaurant has been open a bit longer.

2AYIoiPn9-qwEsh7rSj_TQ.text: We traveled over the river and through the construction for this place - and I'm happy to report that Pie For Breakfast did not disappoint.   I ordered the ham and swiss quiche and it was absolutely delicious. Normally it comes with a side salad, but I subbed out for the much-discussed self-rising bread. It was the perfect amount of food for breakfast.   My husband went with the biscuits and sausage gravy. He said it tasted great, but that it was super rich. He ordered a single pancake on the side and had nothing but good things to say.   We ordered a few chocolate chip and  sugar cookies to go. Both types were amazing and we would definitely recommend. They were soft and flavorful.   As far as service and atmosphere - they jumped on the No Wait train, so we love them for that. Our waitress was incredibly friendly and the food came out relatively quickly considering the place was packed on a Saturday morning. The middle section seating is a little tight and the chairs have rounded backs, so there's no great place to throw a purse...but other than that everything was excellent.   Definitely worth a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Biscuits with Sausage Gravy - Delicious but incredibly rich!
Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Ham and Swiss Quiche - Delicious!

yMZ13t2pXZWZr_BKGXG51Q.text: Disappointed in the food AND the service was extremely rude.   Went here with zero expectations and would have been happy with diner quality food. It was suggested by friends I was meeting (who also had no expectations). Food was about diner quality but much higher prices and much ruder service.   We were told it would be a half hour wait and waited about an hour to be seated. We would have gone somewhere else but at some point it becomes like..."well we've waited this long"....? Wish we'd left.  Server was not friendly and became increasingly rude when one of my companions was asking about vegan options. She was huffy, rolling her eyes, and obviously annoyed. I get it. Dietary restrictions can be irritating. Please consider the ppl you are talking to have just waited an hour and you ADVERTISE that you have vegan options.   My food was fine; I had steak and eggs. Nothing special but not bad. I had a mimosa that was terrible. The sparkling wine was so  flat that it was clear it was premixed and made early in morning. Disgusting. I would have asked to have t taken off if I was the kind of person who did things like that. I am not.   Other companion had food that was fine/ okay. Passable but nothing special.   Third person (the vegan) had the tofu scramble and said it was disgusting and inedible. It looked extremely gross ...it had nothing on the classic tofu scramble some of us remember from the now closed Quiet Storm. This individual sat with us while we ate and didn't eat any of her food .   Not only did server ask ZERO questions about how the food was but she scoffed"not a fan of the scramble huh, guess you don't want it to go" as she took the plate away.  The person was taken aback and said "yeah it wasn't any good can you please take it off the bill?" The server became enraged and huffed away. When she brought us the check she let us know "no one has EVER not liked this scramble before just so you know".   I was shocked how awful and rude this server was and although I had intended to order food to go to take my sick wife at home I abandoned that plan and went to Pamela's a few blocks away.   Would not go back.

m0c4yaTmvow_S93wpOoTiQ.text: Plain and simple my omelet was delicious. It was made with ham, peppers, corn, scallions and swiss. It's served with their made in-house salt rising bread, but sadly I can't eat it being gluten free. I get it, but I was bummed the server didn't mention subbing in something. I would have been cool with fresh fruit. I didn't ask though, so maybe next time I'll see if that can happen. I was happy to enjoy the home fries though!   The place is super cute too. I know they worked with local artist Kim Fox to design the space, including the beautiful tile work on the bar. It's seriously its own work of art! It's a small place, and we went at the height of busy time Sunday at noon. We waited probably around 1/2 hour-ish, which isn't bad at all. Things do move quickly.   They also prefer you only use 2 credit cards per order. Even if you have a large group like we did. They did split the bill, but it took a while for the server to do it. She said the system was complicated, so I felt bad! Just know if you come with a large group, cash is best.  Their website says they're cool with dietary restrictions... Which I'm glad to see. It would be nice to see them make a GF pie! I'd love to be able to sample something... From what I saw they looked delish!

EV8-Vj0cRFJDqhI4X1Qhvg.text: Every time I went to this place(3 times so far), the food and service were good, and I thought the vinegar pie was delicious. However, brunch food here are overall extremely salty and greasy. After the first two visits, I decided to go again to give the benefit of the doubt, but to my disappointment the omelette I had was again too salty.   I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone who is health-conscious or on a diet.

vhX4hSIDOUNRSAwElKm5Kw.text: It's the same owner as Legume as I heard. I have waited for a long time for it to be open. The food is very very good and there are some choices on the menu you can barely get at other restaurants. The price is very good too.

561rPW-s93HRRg48zEERSw.text: Walked a mile out of the way to go to this restaurant specifically because the website said they had vegan options (see pic from website).  We sat down and asked do you have any vegan options and quote: "no, not really... we have some vegetarian options." ANNOYING. And even if I was vegetarian and not vegan, they told us they're out of salad.....(?) and out of the vegetarian quiche.

photos.caption: Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. &#34;Easily made vegan&#34;

1bZwCIO509QS9T51HAkuZg.text: for a place that's called pie for breakfast, i was pretty disappointed by the pie selection.  a friend bought me a slice of s'mores pie to-go on a friday. it was amazing - crumbly crust, rich, smooth chocolate mousse, tasty toasted marshmallows. i was ready for more, so i went with another friend on sunday afternoon.  they were packed and out of half their pie selection at 1:30pm. we tried the vinegar pie ("it's like apple pie without the apples!") and molasses pie, also to go. It took them a long time - long enough to wonder how long it takes to slice a pie - and there wasn't a great space to just stand and wait. the staff were friendly, just busy.  these slices of pie were more disappointing. the taste was okay, but pie crust should be flaky, buttery, and fork tender. we had to saw both slices apart with a knife and it still wouldn't break.  this place has been hyped for nearly 2 years - i lived across the street and the original sign in 2016 said "coming in early 2017!" then it got crossed out and said "mid" then "late" then finally opened in summer 2018. i'll come back to try the breakfast and other diner options, but the pie crust really needs work. I'm hoping I just got a bad batch of dough and that this isn't the regular.

photos.caption: Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. vinegar pie - &#34;like apple pie without the apples&#34; per the staff! the crust was disappointingly hard, difficult to even cut with a knife.
Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. molasses pie - thick and sticky. the crust was disappointingly hard
Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. s&#39;mores pie! rich chocolate, crumbly crust, chewy and tasty toasted marshmallows

Yy1JNbVTnT9Ty_jAlKFTOA.text: One  star for the name and one star for the bread. That place was really crowded and I'm not sure why.  The tables are really cramped, the coffee wasn't very good and I did not encounter one happy staff member.  Attention owner ( you probably don't spend much time there ) the front staff seemed really detached. This is hospitality and requires happiness and engagement with the guests.  The food wasn't superior enough to compensate. If you think there is a great selection of pie... think again. Seems the best breakfast is in the strip district. I really wanted to like this place but couldn't.  Yelp lists this place at 28.  Too high!

_mRhd8fssRYFPrQ_ef0qEw.text: Everything just wasnt that good. My Bf wanted to try it because every time we pass its packed. Both of us were a little disappointed. Food was ok and the restaurant was well staffed but not very attentive. We watched several tables who were ready for checks but no one came while people were waiting to be seated. Could be the reason theres always a line.

24fXMXdhVT3ub-48LbbbvA.text: Such a good place to eat.   I've been enjoying the quiches in particular. Quiche Lorraine was one of the first things I learned to make when I first started cooking, using the recipe in Julia Child's The French Chef Cookbook. Generally, restaurant quiche is overly eggy, and less creamy, but Pie for Breakfast gets it so very right. It's a nice, creamy quiche rather than being scrambled eggs en croute.  This week, they're having one with bacon and Hidden Hills Dairy's Temptation cheese, and I just can't get enough of it.   The service is wonderful, too. (Shout out to Ryan!)  And then there's dessert. They make this chocolate mousse pie on a graham cracker (I think) crust. I've really never had one this good. It is one of the not-so-many perfect dishes I have experienced in life. It simply could not be any better.  I'm hoping the breakfast pie wizards will turn their attention to cherry pie as cherries come into season (or, perhaps, turn to the cherry farms of Michigan). And then there's lemon chess pie. I'll bet they'd make either of those just as perfectly as they do the chocolate mousse pie.

ttsgcDAj5wU2pD9eHmElLA.text: 3.5 stars is a more fair rating... but I'll start here and try them again in a while. Over all everything was reasonably good, but it seemed odd that a place called pies for breakfast only had 3 types of pies to choose from.  My wife and my son in law got the pancakes, I had the omelette with asparagus. It was all prepared well, and came out in a reasonable time, especially for as busy as they were.  The portions are sensible, not large,  although all the sides are extra. Which I guess makes it a little on the expensive side for what it is.   If Pies is in you name, a few more pies to choose from would be in order... they have just been open a few weeks. I'll check back in a few months and see how they adjust.

o2sPSCjGBoUABB89m09okA.text: Stopped by for breakfast.  Soft opening, so limited menu and hours at this time.  Staff was very friendly and able to answer a couple of questions about the menu.   Not a large space with 4 booths, a couple 4 tops and a few 2 tops that they can put together, and about 8 seats at the counter a a few in the window.   Was told they will be open for breakfast, lunch and dinner once they have their legs under them and the soft opening is complete.  The bakery has some interesting items and will be sure to stop back and grab a few items.   Will the food is rather basic it is flavorful and fairly priced.  My corned beef tongue hash with fresh salt rising bread, eggs and mujadara was very good.

3ghmojQi3Z_UlmIf1asroQ.text: I'm super excited that I went somewhere while it's still new!  Of course, I love the name.   Went for breakfast and sat at the counter because it was busy within fifteen minutes of opening. Service was excellent. Had eggs, cottage bacon (didn't really know what that was; is kind of the country ham equivalent of bacon) and salt raised bread (which is an Appalachian thing that's now trendy) and, of course, pie.  Coke products - yay. Besides that, the bread and pie are outstanding. We tried the vinegar pie, which this country girl would call "mock apple pie."  It is a gooey somewhat apple-y filling and the crust isn't flaky, but still delicious.   They also had shoofly and chocolate mousse pie (I think we missed rhubarb by a few days)  Two people, non-alcoholic beverages, shared pie - $30 before tip. Great deal.   Can't wait to try more baked goods and go for lunch or dinner!

photos.caption: Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Adorable logo!
Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Small but mighty draft and liquor selection. Ups for Bluecoat gin and housemade ginger beer!

27jHzX6f3b9L_mulDI_hDw.text: Every single star is directed towards the pie.  While I had lunch here, I can only think of the pie and how I can make an excuse to come back for more pie.  My colleague and I decided to go here for lunch after much anticipation of the opening.  I ordered the 'hearty salad' for $10.  It's hearty, but the size is more on the meager side of things.  It did have nice chunks of fresh blue cheese, beets, and hard boiled eggs.  Hearty, but small.  But tasty.  My friend had the 4 oz pork chop special with two (or maybe three?) sides.    We decided to each order a different piece of pie and then share.  I ordered a rhubarb pie and after one bite did not want to share.  Then I tasted my friend's vinegar pie and I wanted to steal his piece and run.  In honor of my grandma's memory I can't say this is the best pie I ever had but I can certainly say this is by far the best pie I've ever eaten in a restaurant.  I don't even know what a vinegar pie is but somehow it is all I think about.  And the crust was made from the wings of an angel.  Thank you, Pie for Breakfast, for taking forever to open but not disappointing us.  Well worth the wait!

ge37CsgYEEEtKmBeUWOpvQ.text: Finally got to eat here for the first time this morning. We've been dying to go since it opened. Not disappointed! Everything we had was so good, including the service. Can't wait to go again and again. Chai latte, perfect. Endless Napkins on table, perfect (parents, am I right?). Fizzy lemonade perfect. Pancakes, eggs over easy with kielbasa, hash fries and toast, perfect. Biscuit & gravy, bacon, chocolate milk, all perfect. And then the pie...we had vinegar pie which the waitress completely sold us on, and cookies and cream. Only downfall, my stomach is not big enough. Husband said he wants an entire vinegar pie for his birthday, he's done with cake. If that's not a testament to how delicious they were, I don't know what is.  Cannot wait to go again and again and again.

Ehf3FZy-z6BgTnUy_PxtUw.text: My fiance and I visited Pie For Breakfast for breakfast while visiting Pittsburgh. The food was superb. I had the ham with greens and cheesy grits, absolutely delicious! My fiance had the biscuits and gravy. I don't typically like gravy, but I had a bite of his and it was scrumptious! The service was fast and friendly. We also got pie which did not disappoint. Check this place out! You won't regret it!

photos.caption: Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

4zSU-_A8qDkdbcuIafYJrA.text: Great breakfast place! Definitely one we will come back to multiple times. Something to satisfy all tastes. Quick seating for small parties at the counter which is convenient. I got bacon, cheese and avocado omelette and my husband got steak and eggs which was excellent. I wish I would have gotten another slice of bread with my eggs, it was delicious! My husband thought it was the best cold brew he's had as well! Pie to finish up: I got pina colada and he got maple bacon. Neither was too sweet and had great taste!

photos.caption: Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pina colada pie mid enjoyment
Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bacon, cheese, and avocado omelette. Side of salt-rising bread toast. Mocha latte in background

Vz0_SaVhnJP-BLKnneW_AQ.text: It was ok... I expected more for what I paid, bread wasn't good to me kielbasa was dry . My server was nice!

photos.caption: Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Latte

cz3QJYoklXXUsAAwwHtEqA.text: I completely love the name and self-proclaimed concept of country cooking. I was expecting big meals and a menu full of options. Now I know better. I went with a group of 6 friends to celebrate our academic achievements. Unfortunately, they are unable to have more than 2 checks per table so be aware of this beforehand. From the start, we weren't given enough glasses or water for everyone. This was not address for too long during the our visit. I ordered a veggie omelette which came with a side of toast. When I asked for jelly for the toast, I was not informed of the additional charge until the check came. I wasn't impressed with the quality of the omelette or the service so I don't think I will be back. Also, the vinegar pie my friends ordered weren't very appetizing either. If they are offer more options and improve their options, I may be inclined to visit again.

photos.caption: Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Veggie Omelette

H5cBxX6V7mAOVT6bK99dQw.text: Busy at mid-morning on a Sunday. Sat at the counter and ordered coffee and biscuits and gravy. Not what I'm used to, different but fine. Winy, rather acidic but good coffee that I thought benefited from half-and-half. Biscuits that seemed related to the anadama bread (a little molasses?) featured on the menu, thin savory sausage gravy very unlike any I've had before but actually quite good. Maybe a bit expensive but everything in the area is a bit expensive compared with what I'm used to. Good service. Didn't try any pie.

JoHECtEsKHzM4AuGQUiEzw.text: We went there for Sunday brunch - the wait was pretty long, but we appreciated the use of a wait list app so we could keep an eye on our progress on our own.  The atmosphere was casual and cool, and all the servers were incredibly friendly and more than happy to answer all of our questions about the menu and the available pies that day.  My husband ordered the quiche of the day with a couple of sides - cheesy grits and mujadera (rice and lentils).  The sides won the day - they were amazing, totally tasty and flavorful.  My side of sausage was also very tasty.   Unfortunately, the thing I enjoyed least was the piece of pie I chose - the peaches and cream pie.  I had imagined it would be a peach pie with lots of fruit, but it was more of a wet pie, almost like a bread pudding consistency with some chunks of fruit in it, and it was served cold.    All in all, it was a pleasant experience - I probably would have chosen a different pie, or ordered the pancakes, which looked AMAZING.  All in all, a very worthwhile experience, and I would go back.

YrHEiVLksUSKsuxWTsfENA.text: It was recommended that we try this place... it's so-so. I'd go back if I was in this side of town and pretty hungry, but I wouldn't consider choose to eat here again.  We waited 15-20mins, not that bad. The host staff wasn't really attentive, and the wait staff seemed like their only priority was turning tables (not our actual experience).  Additionally, I understand not wanting to do a ton of substitutions and requests, but we had two allergies in our party and the waiter seemed so off put by having to answer our questions about the dishes. Not going to apologize for looking out for our health...  The food is a 6.5/10. Nothing too spectacular, and their prices are far too high for their step-above-diner food.

photos.caption: Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

bSwG773nQO_ns_K-3TxkRA.text: we needed breakfast ...turn to my trusty yelp app on my phone Pie for Breakfast ok sounds good right? what could be bad about pie? after a short look we were able to find parking on the street using the app we had a we wait listed a table it was waiting for us when we walked in he door its not such a big place  tables are pretty close together my pal had bacon and eggs apparently nothing special bacon and coffee which she really liked I had pie (of course) I was dreaming of something fruity with a perfect crust considering their name the pie choices were slim one was peanut butter which I am allergic too  I opted for their vinegar pie it was like a pecan pie minus the pecans it was just ok my toasty bread was nice as nice as toasty bread and jam can be...nothing to write home about or rave on yelp about  their menu has eggs and such for breakfast  service was friendly

photos.caption: Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Vinegar pie
Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

XPHFEG7K6xcApZDK2aP_2w.text: Stopped by here for brunch on a Sunday and got one of their brunch specials! There's a select number of dishes for $18 and it includes a coffe AND a mule, mimosa, or Bloody Mary. I think it's a pretty good deal considering their other entree options don't include many sides so when you add it all together, the $18 definitely seems to be the cheaper option.  I got the fancy omelette and it was pretty good! It came with home fries which were also delicious and their thick buttery toast is to die for! My partner got the pork chop brunch special and said that the side of beans were meh but the collard greens were delicious. Our Moscow mules were super refreshing and apparently they make their own in-hour ginger beer which is pretty freaking awesome.   I hope to come here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Moscow mule
Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pork chop brunch special
Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fancy omelette brunch special

MthN_R9UkPev5BCt9N-ZkQ.text: There's a surprisingly limited selection of pies, and it seems more like a diner than just a breakfast place. They do serve lunch and dinner, and have both sweet and savory options. I guess I was misled by the name.  My friend got pancakes and I got the pork chop, which didn't look so much like one. However the sauce and the sides definitely created a balance of flavors on the plate. It made for a good, filling meal. It was difficult at times to get the attention of the staff, especially when we had additional requests or even when we needed to pay the bill. We walked to the register but they told us to go back and wait. The inside is quite small and a combination of booths and tables. The decoration is a bit random but not too far off from most American diners. I'm not sure if I would go back but I'm glad I got to try the place out. At least now I know whether they're True to their namesake.

photos.caption: Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Limited pie selection

_xI3DnuXT7Jdadti0jXHMw.text: Came here within 30 minutes of opening on a Saturday morning and the restaurant was already full! The wait went by quickly though and service was also very prompt. We had a waiter come by within a few minutes and the food also came out really fast after ordering. I shared the omelette and pancakes, with added pork sausage and the works (peaches and whipped cream on top).   The pancakes were the highlight of the meal. I'm not usually a pancake person but they were delicious! I loved the peaches and whipped cream topping - definitely worth adding and I 100% recommend.   The omelette was just ok. Didn't feel like it was worth the cost and the green beans were definitely an interesting filling. I felt the egg itself was thin and a little rubbery. The pork sausage was also a bit bland for my taste. Good texture but wish it was a bit more flavorful.   Would definitely come back here for the pancakes though!

photos.caption: Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pancakes (with the works), omelette, and a side of pork sausage

2bSI_Erm8GaxRmrBusn7Dw.text: What a great place!  The food is delicious and the prices are reasonable. They always have a great selection of homemade pies that are all amazing. And some great creative cocktails!  I totally recommend getting the Boozy Hot Chocolate. They spike housemate hot chocolate with peppermint vodka and it's amazing. I can't wait to go back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Don&#39;t forget about Pi Day!
Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

KACkBKhzWtxNg6-OM8ZRBQ.text: This is a really cool concept. We came for a lunch midweek and it was already so busy. I've been a huge fan of Legume and Butterjoint so I was really excited when I heard about this place on a recent trip back to Pittsburgh!   The decor is super fun, updated diner style with metal tops and orange chairs. We signed up on the list for tables but they have first come first serve bar seats. I was a little confused about how they manage the list and people waiting and how to nab seats at the bar but I guess you just go for it.   I wanted something savory and went for the lobster omelette. Our waitress told us this omelette rotates what meats go with it based on what Legume serves. This week it was a lobster. I was presently surprised to see how much lobster came in the omelette, a bunch of giant chunks of claw meat! I feel like a lot of restaurants will skimp on meat, really appreciate that the $15 omelette really felt like I got what I paid for. The salt toast that came with was really delicious also.  Of course, because of the name, we had to get both pies available that day-rhubarb pie and vinegar pie. Both were a little too sweet for me, we weren't able to finish either, but the crust was really delicious.   We didn't order any beverages but from our view from the counter they had a great beer and liquor selection.

Dxm3Nx_CUujKciAOb4p16A.text: So my coworker and I were having a bad day and NEEDED a good meal, a good dessert, and a good drink. Let me tell you, Pie for Breakfast was just what the doctor ordered. We both plopped down at the bar because it was pretty full inside during lunch. We ordered Mimosas, and they were the perfect size and perfect mix (it tasted extremely fresh!). We kept seeing waiters go by with quiche so we were pretty much decided that that would be our meal. The vegetarian quiche was leaks and asparagus and we both got the potatoes as a side. WOW. What a perfect meal. I literally didn't leave a single bite. The quiche was so fluffy and had just the right amount of cheese, and the potatoes had great crispy edges. For dessert I was completely torn because all the pies sounded good. However, my friend had been there before and pushed me to get the vinegar pie. I had already decided that I would take it back to my office so I could throw it away if I didn't like it. WELL BUTTER ME UP AND CALL ME BISCUIT, because that was some of the best pie I've ever had! It's like if a mashed apple pie and a pecan pie had a baby. Sugar crust, great filling, and the perfect thing to distract you from work. I really would have that pie for breakfast. They will see my face a lot from now on!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Quiche of the day (leek and asparagus) and yummy potatoes. SO GOOD!
Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Drinks!

fUSVwPedFeY_ax9WEHw9lw.text: This place is a really cute spot in Oakland. Not a lot of seating and wouldn't be good for large groups, but I went on a Sunday morning at 9:30am and got a seat at the counter alone right away. I got the two eggs with bacon, home fries and a biscuit. Get the biscuit with whatever you order!! It was by far the highlight of the meal! I am from the south and judge biscuits harshly, but this one was fluffy on the inside and a little crisp on the outside and so much flavor. The coffee was below average, but would certainly return for the food and the prompt and polite service.

photos.caption: Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Two eggs over medium, with bacon, home fries, and a biscuit. The biscuit was incredible!

dZOcLQVsyviNMYuDWnWloQ.text: I have been waiting for this place to be open since 2017!! I live in the area and I can't tell you how many people have been anticipating PFB's opening.  VINEGAR PIE ($4.50): By the name, you'd think it would taste bad. Surprisingly good. Imagine an apple pie, without the apple part but just the glaze from the apples and that as the whole pie, that's what this tasted like to me! Not bad not bad! But too sweet for me. RHUBARB PIE ($4.50): Very good also. Can't compare it to the vinegar pie because they're pretty different. This one was a bit tangy and not super sweet so like a palate cleanser from the vinegar pie. CHOPPED LAMB STEAK W/ RHUBARB CHUTNEY ($12): I thought it would be an actual lamb steak but this was more like a meat loaf. Rhubarb chutney was good. Compare it to a cranberry sauce! My 3 sides were: cornbread, braised greens, and mashed potatoes!  Prices are decent for dinner! Decor is interesting, there are a bunch of mirrors on the wall. I want to come back, but for the breakfast/brunch because I wasn't all for the soft opening dinner menu.

-LSsAi7NnIUG5rkJBFuDEQ.text: A delicious spot for brunch. The house-made quiche with several sausages in it was nice, especially when paired with a light side salad. The vinegar pie (which is mostly just a very sugary sugar-tasting pie) was a hit with my family, though not me. Sadly, they were out of their other pies. One of the intriguing aspects of this place is that it is tied in with next door neighbor Legume (one of my favorite restaurants anywhere), which makes me interested in trying the bar, since we always enjoy Butter Bar.

photos.caption: Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. At the bar, a good selection of alcohol

OsVlEZO7BmuuQloxZ7lFtA.text: I have nothing but good things to say about this gem! If you are in the area, it is worth a visit - and make sure to get brunch drinks and explore the menu. As the restaurant's name suggests, getting their quiche ('pie') for breakfast is a very legitimate and worthwhile option. I can honestly say that I've never had quiche that was creamier or more rich! They offer meat and vegetarian options, and had so many awesome sounding dishes that I can't wait to go back and try more things. While the Middle Eastern mujaddara is a delicious side option, it didn't exactly feel like a breakfast dish. While enjoying the atmosphere, my friends and I were commenting on how they were trendy without being pretentious. They didn't waste time or energy making complicated dishes, but they did an awesome job using fresh and delicious foods to prepare an enticing and trustworthy menu. The mimosas were good - with fresh orange juice (light pulp). I will definitely find my way back here happily on a future visit to PGH.

photos.caption: Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Vegetarian quiche with cucumber salad
Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bacon, egg and cheese quiche with mujaddara
Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Eggs, toast and mujaddara

tS-gm8YDJdUnBKo3V8iGRg.text: It was alright. Nothing to write home about. Visiting Pittsburgh and was recommended to us. Food was good but overpriced. My wife and I both got a breakfast plate and ended up being $35. Would go back if someone wanted to go but no actively seeking to go back. Staff was friendly and was greeted right when we walked in. Overall good experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Breakfast plate.  Omelet plate.
Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Store front

2cEawCziPnlzrB_Lwioq5g.text: This week's brunch club took us to "Pie For Breakfast."  When I arrived, I was told there'd be a 30 minute wait, and that was accurate - points for efficiency at a high-traffic time. I love the neighborhood diner feel, which makes the luxe flourishes (such as Bonne Maman preserves) feel like such a pleasant juxtaposition. I ordered the omelet with avocado, bacon, and cheddar. For such a simple sounding dish, the flavor was surprisingly stunning!  The home fries were rustic, crispy, and delicious. The salt bread, humble looking though it may be, packs serious flavor. Service was fast, friendly, and competent. The ambiance is so bright and cheerful that it's a challenge not to have a great day after coming here. Pie For Breakfast for brunch will get the groove started. It's your job to keep the groove going!

photos.caption: Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Omelet with avocado, bacon, and cheddar, salt bread, and mimosa. Delicious.

uKenzfRzrdDALC6g3Du08Q.text: I had a decent breakfast there with my partner that was spoiled by a poor slice of pie and an unsatisfactory response by the server when asked if I liked the rhubarb pie.  There was what appeared to be tofu scramble in the soggy crusted pie.  Gross to behold and wasn't able to be overcome by the taste (substandard).  The crumb topping was good though but nothing could be worse than the waiter's complete milk toast response which was "oh, you didn't like it?  The white scrambled stuff in it?   I don't know, cream cheese, maybe mascarpone...) then walks away and allows me to pay for it.   I honestly wouldn't have ordered it if I knew that, it wasn't stated on the board.  It just said rhubarb pie.  I love fruit pies and appreciate that there's generally no dairy in it as I am lactose intolerant.  Just not a great experience.

6xwsZ7jnnaGlg194MnHfEQ.text: I drove past this place a few times and decided one Saturday to come in and try it for breakfast. The wait time wasn't that bad compared to some of the other popular breakfast spots in the city. There aren't a lot of parking spaces outside, so i had to park in the garage across the street, so keep in mind that will add at least an extra $6 to your costs. I was impressed to see what looked like a full bar available for breakfast. Some of the breakfast meals even come with drinks....nice for brunch with friends. They also have a few vegetarian options. I ordered eggs with a side of potatoes and it came with an interesting tasting toast. The eggs and potatoes were good. I am not sure about the salt rising toast though, I cant say it wasn't good...just different. I probably would come back if i am in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

qupBCMHaxl_FMOhX96WNUQ.text: Cute breakfast spot. A little fancier than a diner, but mostly a diner feel. Except, there's a full bar...so that's something. A diner, but with cocktails! I had the ham and cheese quiche and vinegar pie, which were both delicious. I had never had vinegar pie before and the servers description was spot-on. The filling is like a tart version of an apple pie minus the apples. I sat at the bar and the service was great and the servers were very attentive.

vtGvEM_FTJ-V3BxyBx1LZQ.text: Such a good experience. I had the steak and eggs with a side of pickled beets. The bread is amazing, the steak was tender and seasoned perfectly and the beets were awesome. Some lady was next to us and had a freakout for no reason. The staff was non- reactive despite her trying to get a reaction from them. They handled her outburst extremely professionally and gracefully and apologized to us even though it wasn't their fault. We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Steak and eggs, side of pickled beets

aIKwbZ2uSNm-YOWDDtmG0Q.text: Good food, great staff, and a really nice ambiance. If you're thinking about going here definitely try it.

of-APMywwYvLeEJ9rj-IhA.text: Gave this place a second try, and loved it way more. The food was great and filling. I got the grits, greens and beans and finished with leaches & cream pie.  One downside is that there are no alternative meat options that are not pork! a turkey sausage or of the like would be fantastic.

I9n3rmkSMq-tvDdcrYLgaw.text: Such an adorable spot for brunch! We came here right around lunch so the food took just a tiny bit longer than average, but it was SO worth it! We both got one of the regular pies which change throughout the week. There were 3 options so we decided on the chocolate mousse pie! This isn't a traditional pie with a dough crust, but it is one DELICIOUS pie for sure! They also have fruit pies!   Then, I got the 2 eggs with bacon, Anandama toast, and mujadara. I have never heard of or tried the last two sides so I was excited! Anandama toast is a salt-rising bread toast so it is very thick yet has a slight molasses sweetness. It was SO perfect paired with butter, my eggs and the mujadara which was a lentil curry-flavored rice!   My boyfriend got the two buttermilk pancakes with chocolate chips which of course, was thick and drool-worthy! The staff was friendly and the decor inside is cute: mirrors, bright colors, booths, tables, window seats, and a bar! Next time, I will definitely have to try one of the coffee cocktails!

photos.caption: Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Buttermilk pancakes with chocolate chips
Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chocolate mousse pie $4.50
Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chocolate mousse pie

gsS90x8K0_urMIPi6vpC2g.text: *MEDIOCRE*  Pie for breakfast just opened up not long ago, so I thought I'd check it out since I'm a foodie and I love trying new food. I went during breakfast time and I ordered their omelette. Personally, I'm not a big fan of American breakfast food, but it's not bad. The omelette I ordered had asparagus in it which may seem odd at first. ASPARAGUS? In an omelette?? I wasn't sure whether I should eat it plain or with ketchup. It was definitely a bit more watery than a regular omelette. It was green. It wasn't bad, but it wasn't amazing. The egg was fine, just the asparagus in it that made me confused. Oh well  VERDICT:  Would I order the omelette again? Probs not   Would I go back again? Only if you ask me to

RZ-hDz7uUkRR1PjmvXmx1w.text: I have not even tried the pies here, but I have been here twice for breakfast and loved it. The shishito pepper quiche is amazing. The selection of sides is extensive and unique. I loved the pickled beets. The anadama toast is delicious as well. You will not leave feeling weighed down like you may at a typical diner, but you will be full. There is usually a wait, and you can expect to pay a bit more for your breakfast than you would at somewhere like Pamela's. I cannot wait to return and try some of their pies here!

photos.caption: Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bacon cheddar quiche
Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Shishito pepper quiche with anadama toast and pickled beets
Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Kielbasa and eggs

WT4LAXSFmEtxT7a-yA_KIw.text: Outstanding breakfast. Pittsburgh has several excellent breakfast options. Vinegar pie at Pie of breakfast, with a plate of eggs is one of the better options in the city. The room is small, be prepared to wait for a table. Once you eat there, you want to return. I will return.

photos.caption: Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Vinegar Pie
Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

JUQ1XUokQy6YSXPbhDLfeg.text: The vinegar pie was good and the place is a cute breakfast place to eat at with a friend. The quiche tasted good (it was something with ramps and potatoes and something else I think?) as did the mujadara (good but had weird hard bits like stale rice), but overall this place has enough things I dislike that I probably wouldn't come back.   First off, the pies are good and worth trying as well as the quiche and omelettes, but beyond those much of the menu just feels like a overcharged oilier version of easy breakfast items I could make for myself. Second, everything here is really really oily. It's all fine and good when you start eating, but both my friend and I left feeling quite nauseous from the heavy food.

photos.caption: Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Quiche, mujadara, vinegar pie, and a omelette

dQcLBdq1HKazJXtn4gO-Tw.text: I went there with a group of six. We were squeezed into the booth. If you have a big party I would recommend getting separated table.   The vinegar pie was good, but the crusts were too hard. I also got the biscuits and gravy and it was decent. I have to ask about my order since I was the only one left in the group without the food. The food is okay here but the price is a bit out if range for breakfast. $11 for omelette is just too much for me.   Will probably not go back again

photos.caption: Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Biscuits and gravy
Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Vinegar pie

Mmg407VeedaiYQVFCFr6TA.text: a dear friend recommended this breakfast place since we are BIG on breakfast and it was amazing! it was cash only the morning we were here??!? but no worries. seated pretty fast and the space iwas clean, bright and inviting.  tables are tiny but booths are at a premium.  my SO ordered their commonwealth ground coffee and i had an iced tea. and yes...people do have pie for breakfast.  we had a slice to go. :) he ordered the two buttermilk pancakes (warmed maple syrup) and house made breakfast sausage patty.  i ordered the vegan delight (savory... not sweet) and it was fabulous.  black eyed peas, braised greens, cucumber salad, fresh beets, not canned!!, and mujadara.  refills came quickly on the drinks (i was given an iced tea to go) and we had an attentive but not hovering server.   a fun and great place to try for breakfast with an interesting menu.  if you are a grits fan...def go!

photos.caption: Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. bar seating for eating and drinking.
Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. eclectic dining space.

ZN8vg8hBt-ppuPH5asfquQ.text: Two things, vinegar pie and pancakes.  Yes everything was great but the vinegar pie (first time having it) and pancakes made me feel like family made this personally for me.    The pancakes tasted just like my mothers, they were eggy and buttery, with crisp edges.  The vinegar pie, I got it just to try I mean after all, it is pie.   It's amazing and not at all what one would expect from a dessert called vinegar pie.  Go visit pie for breakfast, you'll love it

photos.caption: Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chocolate brownie pie
Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Vinegar pie
Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chocolate brownie pie

zOXi4CMhs4vaBXuOiA6HwA.text: Impressive all the way around. This is a wonderful breakfast place with wonderful food and excellent service.   It's the same ownership as Legume and Butterjoint next door, so they launch with a lot of expertise and resources.   There are a lot of great items on the menu, for example Salt-Rising Bread. I don't know too many places that serve it, although this traditional Appalachian offering is making a comeback, and you should order here to find out why.  I was somewhat critical of the $3.50 price for a side of grits, however when I looked up the $90 wholesale cost for a 20 lb bag of Anson Mills Grits, I can see why the price is that high.   My Omlette of the Day was Kimchi, and it certainly packed flavor.   They use Commonplace Coffee, which is a great choice.   Gwen was our server and she was helpful and attentive. I don't see how anyone can wrong here.

photos.caption: Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. House made ginger beer

XB36CQ4GhQIWp4XZaIBDDw.text: Probably a 3.5 for me.     The good... - The bacon and cheddar quiche was really good (except for a temperature issue - see below) - The side of potatoes that came with the quiche were crispy and delicious.   - The vinegar pie.  This reminded me of a pecan pie without the pecans.  Overall, it was weird, but in a good way.    - The service - prompt and efficient.    The eh... - The space.  It's pretty, but not at all comfortable.  Too many tables and those stupid metal chairs that dig into your sides.    - The biscuits and gravy.  Not a super traditional rendition of this dish and it just seemed to be missing something.    - The temperature on my quiche.  It was lovely and warm for the first bit or two, but the center was cold - a bad reheat job or something.  It would have been top notch if not for that.    - The prices.  This was a lot for breakfast.  It was good and all, but not something I could see myself doing regularly.

OanS929mdIWuQO51f5eSmA.text: Vinegar Pie does not sound like the most appetizing thing.  And even after our server explained its taste, I still wasn't entirely sure.  But since everybody says you need to try it, my friend and I ordered a slice of it along with a slice of apple pie for breakfast.  Well, more specifically breakfast dessert.  Yes, I know the name of the place is Pie for Breakfast.  And for that reason alone I have been wanting to stop by since they opened.  But they have a good looking menu with lots of other sweet and then savory options.   As soon as I opened the menu, though, I knew what I wanted: the minute steak with eggs and sides of grits and side salad.  The salad was mixed greens tossed in a vinaigrette.  The grits were creamy.  The eggs were dippy.  And they all went perfectly with that steak and met all my high expectations.    To top it off, the vinegar pie was a delightful treat.  It was sweet but not too sweet.  Much better than I imagined it would be.  The apple pie was solid.  But yeah, that vinegar pie is a must.  They offer some fancy drinks (coffee, cocktails, beer) but I stuck with water and coffee.  The interior isn't very big but they make it work with a smaller space.  It's got a cozy diner feel that I liked, too.  Prices weren't outrageous for the portions and quality.  I'm sure I'll be back for some (vinegar) Pie for Breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. vinegar pie in the front, apple pie in the back
Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Minute Steak with eggs, cheesy grits and side salad

JQ8OpomDoB6kRjdyy_D8RA.text: Wowwowowowowow!  Vibe: A Food: A Service: A Prices: A  My BF and I were on the Pittsburg tour with some relatives and they took us here. When I heard the restaurant name "Pie For Breakfast", I thought.. typical Midwest having pie for breakfast - I'm from Ohio. Then I thought, well maybe "Pie For Breakfast" means "Pizzas For Breakfast" - that sounds delicious. I was wrong.. it is literally pies for breakfast. BUT I was not disappointed.  PFB reminds me of an old 50s dinner with an edge. It has amazing vegetarian options and quite a spread. I ordered the vegetarian biscuits and mushroom gravy - yummy! The portion was perfect and not too heavy. For dessert for breakfast I got pie! I ordered the Vinegar Pie and OMPie it was delicious! I love vinegar, pickles, sour everything! But the vinegar pie wasn't too sour its was just DELICIOUS! Do you think PFB will deliver to Hawaii?

photos.caption: Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Vinegar Pie! Yes please!

Q23PTAnCovc8sE9nEBHtNg.text: OMPie!!!  How I love it here. So every single time we go to have "pie for breakfast" we don't. I mean we get the pie but as dessert.  It's just so hard to turn away brekkie here. I mean like real brekkie. The eggs and ham are always spot on yummy. Also it's a big serving so my boyfriend and I often split a platter.  The chocolate and vinegar pies are the best. Can never decide when they're both on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

IMqlbtv6Iga7-UgxvnMB2Q.text: Wow..this place was really good!! Why not 5 stars you ask. We'll I like to have a little more elbow room when I'm out for a meal. The tables are very close together (and some people like that). I know that if they were farther apart the wait would be longer. So not saying I would change that, just saying why I didn't give that 5th star. Our server was terrific. She explained items we weren't familiar with and offered suggestions. We settled on the grits, beans and greens and the quiche of the day. We also got toast with homemade jelly. YUM! We ordered pie-but, had to take it to go. DELICIOUS!! Not too sweet with perfect spice and lots and lots of apples. I definitely recommend using the YELP call-ahead feature. We had no wait when we got there. Will be back for sure!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Yummy tea

Onkv7Rif3aOHJcmFTkRm7w.text: I came here on a crowded Sunday with my bestie and despite the odds, we snagged a couple seats at the bar right away. The bartender was great and we got some drinks pronto!  I had the quiche and collard greens, my friend had the benedict. I wasn't a fan of my chai latte, and her mimosa was only so-so. But drinks aside, we really liked the food!  Prices are reasonable, but be prepared to wait. It's a busy spot on the weekends!

photos.caption: Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chai latte

_05UIR-b23fa3vs2MpPHwg.text: I had been meaning to go to Pie for breakfast since it opened this past year. I finally was able to give it try with two of my friends. We decided to go on a Sunday around 1 pm. It was packed! Which I find as good sign; I love seeing new business crowded. The hostess took our name and told us it would be about a thirty minute wait, but a few minutes she informed us three seats were available at the bar, which we gladly took.  This restaurant is small and adorable. All the staff were very friendly. Only fault was that even though we were sitting at the bar my coffee never got refilled.   I ordered the biscuits and sausage gravy. They did not disappoint! Definitely a must try. The biscuits are full of flavor, flaky, and moist. While the gravy smothers them they don't get soggy.
