I surprised to see that this modern dinner services alcohol. They had some of the brunch standards like Mimosas and such. They also had a small collection of liquors and beers behind the bar, a lot being local to PA.  Not only did Pie for breakfast have local alcohol they sourced a lot of their menu locally as well. All their meat entrees are made with meat produced in PA.  I can't wait to come back and try more of their menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Biscuits and Sausage Gravy

CCuClQOoTnraZAIdbmu9_g.text: Love this place. I've brought friends and family here for breakfast a few times and the food, service, and staff have always been wonderful. Bottomless coffee is always a plus. All their pies are fantastic and I'll definitely be coming in for those coffee cocktails after finals! Regarding the menu- check online or call ahead, since their pies are seasonal.   Best breakfast item: the quiche and salad  Best pie: vinegar. I know it sounds weird but it's SO GOOD. Imagine apple or pecan pie...without the fruit/nuts. Just that filling. It's a good time.

photos.caption: Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Took a cookies and cream pie to go. Paired well with great British bake off!
Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Dinner menu
Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

L-FgtRe4J-wtduQeJJm1hg.text: I was sitting at the bar and no one offered to refill my water. I think that's a little questionable, especially since I was at the bar. Besides that, I had a fabulous experience.   I came in with two friends at around 1:00PM.  It was very crowded but luckily, there were three seats at the bar. The food came out in a timely manner.   I ordered the biscuits and gravy and a piece of vinegar pie. The biscuits and gravy were delicious!! The biscuits reminded me of the cheddar biscuits at Red Lobster. They were crisp outside and didn't get soggy because of the gravy. The gravy itself was excellent, I finished my whole plate without hesitation. The sausage chunks are big enough and left me full.   The vinegar pie is DELICIOUS. The best pie I've had in awhile. Like previous reviews, I'd compare it to pecan pie without the nuts. The filling was similar to pecan pie however, more tangy because of the vinegar. The crust was delicious- very buttery and flaky. I'm so happy I tried this place. I was tempted to get another piece of pie however, I decided not to because I didn't want to get sick of the food.   I left satisfied and wanting more. I can't wait to come back!!   Updated: went in today to try their cookies and cream pie. It was tasty, kind of a cheesecake like pie. It was very rich and similar to the Burger King Hershey sundae pie. The vinegar pie still is my favorite.

photos.caption: Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Menu
Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Vinegar pie
Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Biscuits and sausage gravy

Fp5GUfqnc2nVIDTyrITWTw.text: I ate here for the first time and what a cool place! We went around 11:30 on a Saturday morning so the place was pretty packed. The space is not big at all similarly to the sibling restaurants Legume and Butterjoint right next door. But a different vibe for sure! You have to be seated for tables and booths however the counter is first-come first-serve. Since there were just two of us, we waited for the counter and waited approximately 10-15min. I ordered two pancakes and a side of bacon. The pancakes were some of the fluffiest I had ever eaten-- perfect! And the bacon was delicious! The coffee was great as well; it's Commonplace Coffee. The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. I'll be back time and time again to try different things on the menu especially the pie because well, it's in the name people!

photos.caption: Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

p77fYkLH1OMEg5JyghMZCg.text: The decor and service were great. Coffee was nice and strong. The blueberry muffin was delicious. Loved the biscuits but not the gravy. Didn't actually have any pie...

s9Q2jqY0sgSrOO584MuGOA.text: This place has great breakfast and lunch options. The omelette was great, fluffy and delicious. However, there's only 4 kinds of pie. The place has Pie in the name, so I thought there would be more options, so that's disappointing. I'd like to see more pie variety in the future.

GGNiXEHsoZk1Y4AstDx12Q.text: Great place for brunch ....Food was really good and employees were very friendly !! They also sell pies and they looked delicious.

2pGAqyaZBQQ1KLKJiqTHwg.text: Hands down, best breakfast I have ever had in my life. Best service as well. Nicole is the tits. You go girl.

cskYEu3JOhn9qQxZyKY0og.text: I expected a lot from reading other reviews.  We also love Legume so we were expecting the pie to be fantastic. The food was good but portions were a bit small for the price.  If you are looking for a good breakfast for a more reasonable price, I would head to Pamela's any day of the week over Pie.  As other reviewers noted, they need to work on their pie crust.  It is very tough and not flaky at all.

3MuGYO___RORN7m1UgB7Tg.text: While the other food is definitely good, the pie is really where it is at with the place. Maybe skip the rest and just eat two pieces of pie for breakfast? The name of the place is confusing... you expect that all the food will be in some pie form, but really it is fancy diner food with showstopping pie for dessert. Definitely worth a try, even if you just want to grab a piece of pie to go (or to eat immediately as you are walking back to your car - no judgment here).

EFkrrqrRXOm7AEsZ3YvDRw.text: In Pittsburgh? Need food? This should be on your list. Eggs? Perfect! Quiche? Outstanding! Customer service and wait staff? Friendly, efficient and really pays attention to the customer. Place was busy but we never felt rushed. Looking forward to next visit.

bGuCHK0mPi6qKIbjY3WDsw.text: Like many folks, I was waiting (a long time!) for this place to open.  The "sister" restaurants of Legume and Butterjoint are fantastic, so I figured that anything from the same chef would be amazing.  Unfortunately, the 2 times I've eaten here have been disappointing, and I can't recommend it.    Generally, the food is fine... but just that.  You won't find a hearty breakfast here -- the portions are sadly meager -- but neither will you find a unique take on diner food.   The breads were great, eggs were just ok.   The coffee was only so-so -- a real miss given the number of great coffee roasters in Pittsburgh.   Like a few other reviewers, I also found the pies to be lacking.  Heavy dough, weak flavors, nothing special.   I think this place could be a real gem, but they have to decide what they want to be: a classic diner with hearty fare to start your day, or a special eatery that reaches the same level as Legume.

I8A009VXERGNUYsUPRlRxQ.text: I had been looking forward to the opening of this restaurant as many others have for quite a long time. I am hopeful that my experience was due to just opening and not a precursor of things to come.   The staff was friendly and knowledgeable about the menu however there were problems when it came to asking about items being vegetarian. I ordered two sunny side up eggs, salt toast, hash browns and coffee. The server did not bring, or ask, if cream or sugar was needed nor bring them. Eventually I was brought creamers but had to ask the people at the next table for their sugar. I also had to flag down the server for jam or jelly. The toast and hash browns had a definite mouth feel and taste of animal fat. I asked the server about this so she went to ask the chef. She returned to tell me they used clarified butter. A fairly lame excuse. Clarified butter does not make food take on the flavor and mouth feel of lard. I went on to order the salt bread toast. It was served with a raspberry coulis, something that I would have appreciated with my first order and which was quite good. The toast is grilled so again the distinct flavor of animal fat, particularly lard, was front and center. Front of house came to ask how things were and I asked why the flavor of animal fat was so distinct as I was told my items were vegetarian by both the server and the chef. I asked if the grill was being used for vegetarian and non vegetarian items, which it is. The grill is quite small and I was told that there is no divider to separate the foodstuffs. So you may order hash browns that are grilled in the same area where bacon was just removed. It's definitely something that needs to be rectified and I have faith that it will.

10VdE5C8VYjDezcFcIfKKg.text: We had a mixed experience here during a busy Saturday morning. First the good... food was very good, especially the scrambled eggs, over easy eggs, and sausage. Excellent in taste and served hot. The side potatoes would have been great as well, however they came to our table barely lukewarm so that's a minus. Pancake was raw in the middle - we sent that one back and received a cooked one, free of charge. As far as the negatives go... our estimated wait time was 30 minutes, which we were fine with however the actual wait to be seated was over an hour. Had we known that, we would have decided not to have breakfast here on this day. Also, they served a cappuccino in a drinking glass so the lack of an insulated glass made the drink very hot to hold onto at first and then allowed it to get cold pretty quickly. We may give this place another try during a not so busy time but find it hard to recommend at this time.

vQTahvq_u37sdO4s0_Uf-A.text: the food is weigh more too expensive. The quality and price do not match and always crowded.

zd6LHyfJah1ml4TOKeP1ng.text: Went in on a Sunday morning around 10:00, waited around 10 minutes, and we were seated as soon as a table opened - the place was packed for breakfast. We ordered a few different things at my table, but my meal was fantastic. Two eggs, crispy potatoes, sauteed kale, and a slice of their amazing homemade salt rising toast. The toast was dense and soft and unique, and I highly recommend getting it as a side no matter what you order. I also had a slice of the vinegar pie to round out my breakfast, and it was gooey and sweet and had a hint of tartness from the vinegar. The peaches and cream pie, which was ordered at my table as well, was much less sweet than the vinegar pie, but was creamy and tasted entirely homemade - no canned peaches here. My friend ordered the biscuits and sausage gravy, which I tasted, and they were savory and warm and very delicious. The menu is still small as they work out the kinks and find their footing, but it's a really cute place and it's evident that there is a lot of love put into the food and service.

wvs-K_-2qZ4X9CjUI8XADg.text: I had been looking forward to eating at Pie for Breakfast.  But I was seriously disappointed.  First of all the noise level is incredible.  We could not hold a conversation, It was very warm.  Albeit, it was hot outside.  The food was average, at best.  I had eggs and a pancake.  The pancake was tough, eggs were fine, not anything special.  We had pie at the end of the meal which was the high point. Hope that they improve.  It's a good location in Oakland.

j1QL7AYhJnzy5BYW7_ekjw.text: This place sort of sucks. Limited breakfast options, dinner menu seemed to be from a restaurant with a wholely different concept. Limited variety of pies. Smelled sort of like stale beer. Biscuits and sausage gravy was cold, flourery, and flavorless. Also had pancakes, they were fine.

_AJHSTnb9MOEcqwyO4J7Cw.text: Good food, good service, good ambiance. Had breakfast special with 2 eggs, home fries, toast and sauteed greens. Everything was pretty good, especially the home fries. The greens were tasteless and limp.

kQDFlVr6GB5YrKTMKayU2Q.text: For a place with "Pie" in the title, they didn't have that many pies on the menu.  Three to be exact.  Went in for lunch on a weekday with my boyfriend, and we got a meat pie to start, I got the omelette and he got the pork chops.  Meat pie was cold, which surprised me.  The crust was good, but the filling, nothing special.  The omelette was filled with peppers, peas and tomatoes, as advertised, but I didn't get any of the herb taste.  Also lacking in flavor.  My boyfriend's pork chops were also OK, but nothing amazing.  The coffee was good though, probably the best thing we got.  Probably won't go back anytime soon.

3NJt5vVWc1yfZRu5FJZBuQ.text: The food is delicious, but this place is terrible if you have young kids. Very few of the tables accommodate a high chair, first instance. We'll be back in a few years.

owu58qjOrwZ-9neSWIwFwA.text: They've perfected the classic two egg and home fries breakfast. The toast is delicious as well. Great coffee and fantastic service in a really neat atmosphere. Definitely coming back for more!

2c5Phb44dScRdAsmFST8EQ.text: At last! An every day place to go for a good reasonable meal or just a good place for coffee and tea and smackerole of something after class and with neighbors and special friends!  The food is fresh and homemade. The service is friendly and helpful.

VspbhAuGF5iJmeYeofjnjQ.text: Breakfast was fine.   Super thin pork chop and eggs.  I could have made the same, if not better, at home.   Was NOT worth the 45 minute wait.  Of course I also had pie.  Peach flavor was good but texture reminded me of pie that had been refrigerated for too long.

kvfPXKokYB3HZihEe4rdIQ.text: Good place for a nice breakfast, but the pie wasn't as good as I was expecting given the name. The location is rather nice with some lovely mirrors hanging all along the walls. Probably not the best place for breakfast in the area, but definitely good.

p4EqdePAjXvDtr6ywX1Iyg.text: Delicious! Got the kielbasa, cheesy grits and home fries. Best grits I've had next to Savannah, GA. Had the vinegar pie..awesome, tasted like apple pie. Also had the chocolate pie, it was good but not as good as the vinegar. Only negative- used the yelp waitlist app and they didn't seem to know what that was, so we sat at the bar, where we received great service.

g0tOHMP6zBOsa3VKJ8J_Uw.text: I'm not the kind of person who gives bad reviews very often. I expected so much better after the hype about this place and the mostly good reviews. Waitress never came over to ask how our breakfast was and never asked if we wanted refills on our coffee. My husband's buttermilk pancakes were average, my friend's omelette was small and not that good. My quiche was very good though. I thought the breakfast menu was limited

n_Dkd4sAnCuh3yw_ULscOA.text: This place was fantastic for an early dinner (in the summer it used to be open for dinner).  Just be careful- some of the pie crusts are made with lard. The wait staff is very good about knowing what's vegetarian and what isn't. Inexpensive and great food.

s95u2fDERAYEOpy5RA9FaA.text: Definitely crowded, but most "new" places start off with a rush from those seeking something new and exciting...  New and trendy, full bar at 9am Sunday morning, and very fluffy pancakes!  All score check marks in the win column.  However the full bar was a little bit of a put off, especially after witnesses the wait staff "sample a drink right before serving said drink to a customer". Yeah, the did the finger vacuum straw thing to check the "consistency" of the drink, but still a little put off.  Although this is a "trendy" vibe place, I was surprised to see they didn't offer any alternatives with breakfast meats outside of ham or bacon.  The menu was certainly targeted to a more "brunch-like" fare than True breakfast, but hey...it's new and trendy.  A solid 3 stars...I may try again, but if first impressions are the True lasting ones...then I'll sure I won't make a "special trip".

pJ_eHOMfrdSwJFdNC_w8nw.text: This place is so good!!! Everything tastes like genuine home cooked food. I got the four sides and all of them were great, especially the mashed potatoes and greens. I had a chocolate chip cookie and oat milk latte for dessert. Definitely coming back

yzNEG-w3YBUK_a5N9ERnfg.text: When you take a group of seven to a joint that doesn't take reservations, you KNOW you're going to wait. And we did. For an hour. It's no big deal. Though, side-note to all restaurants -- PLEASE take reservations; like, real ones. Anyway, after the wait, we were seated amongst the lovely tables, counter and booths (though the super cute chairs were super uncomfortable) and greeted by our friendly server. From start to finish, our experience took a cool two and a half hours. I was amongst friends, so truly, this did not bother me. What got a little dicey was the wait for food since, apparently, they only have four burners and that posed a challenge for all the egg orders -- and the time it took to get our change which was so lengthy, the place was nearly empty by the time we left. Our server was TRYING, but it really felt like the restaurant in general is not prepared for a group of this size. In any case, the food is decent, the place is cute and the pie (I hear) is amazing. I'd suggest bringing ONE friend and arriving early.

bVbKFUOmrI-zKn0sY7iMkg.text: Overall, I think the food was okay., the maple syrup is so very good.  Very flavorful and not too sweet.  I'm sticker-shocked by how outrageously expensive the cost of orange juice is.  I ordered two orange juices for the kids, and this is what was served.  Less than half cup for a small OJ, $3.50.  I asked the sever if the juice is freshly squeezed, and he replied it isn't but it is not from concentrate either.  I then asked if the juice is refillable?  He replied no it is not and walked away.

CsK__DO60FUlHftUYEV19w.text: I have waited for the opening of this place for over a year!  It is finally open and I had the idea in my head they really only served pie-both sweet and savory.  I was surprised that they actually only have 3 types of pie on their menu and when we went they were out of one.  Have no fear they still have plenty of yummy options including muffins, cookies and a full breakfast menu.  This place is small so I do not recommend it for large groups. We had seven in our party and waited over an hour to be seated.  Our waitress was flustered by our large group and could not separate checks well nor split up payments so this presented a problem.  The food also took a long time to come out as they only have 4 burners and most of us ordered eggs so it took a long time for them to cook.  I went with 2 scrambled eggs with toast, home fries and I added on the cucumber salad. Everything was extremely tasty including the cucumber salad-light and refreshing with a pickled flavor.  The toast is on a homemade bread which was delicious but I was disappointed they only gave us 1 piece.  A few in our party ordered pie for dessert and the vinegar and chocolate pie (thicker moose) were favorites.

x7TmtndDHorEQDReMZC8dw.text: Really good food and low key atmosphere. You have to get the vinegar pie, it really is that good. Sad the mushroom gravy was taken off the menu but maybe someday it'll return. Love those biscuits. And good, friendly service too!

raWKhRRWmywFVi8ZLPPRuA.text: Absolutely love this place, a touch pricey for a college student normally but a great place to take your family when they're in town or just as a relaxing place to get a genuinely wonderful breakfast every month.

2dWmMZzF-cgNe0hzmWloUg.text: Great breakfast- biscuits and gravy are top notch. Try the vinegar pie. Sounds weird but super delicious.

yXdgccTqCoZPXc4x6eu8CQ.text: I really enjoyed my dinner! The restaurant is cute and modern on the inside, kind of like a nice diner. I had the chicken thighs in soy and garlic, cheese grits, bacon-y kale and mujadara and they mixed perfectly together. The chicken thighs we're boneless which was an added benefit to me. I felt like the portion size was ideal. I could enjoy everything without waste and had room for pie. I'm not really sure what genre of food this is - maybe southern homestyle with an international twist? But it was awesome. It looks like they change the menu periodically, which I like in a restaurant. They offer draft and bottle beer, wine and cocktails. I had the gin-gin mule and it was refreshing on a hot day. I'll definitely be back.

H-w4um9lXbVIhCY9zsN8xg.text: I stopped by for dinner during their soft opening this evening and I was quite impressed... I sat at the bar where Dillon waited on me immediately while providing pleasant conversation. I asked for an Arnold Palmer and although this beverage was not on their list of offerings, Dillon mixed one per my request. I ordered "comfort food" - two 4 oz. Pork Chops with Stewed Rhubarb along with three sides - Mashed Potatoes, Black-Eyed Peas and Rice Pilaf. The dinner was delivered quickly and my meal was awesome! I am a big fan of pork chops and they were cooked perfectly. The mashed potatoes were especially done well - with just the right consistency, texture and a great home-style taste. Yes, I do recommend "Pie for Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner"!!  :-)   Dillon told me that they will be open until Midnight during the week on a consistent basis. This is just the type of restaurant we need on North Craig Street. I imagine the neighborhood will provide a warm welcome to this dining establishment...

photos.caption: Photo of Pie For Breakfast - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pie for Breakfast - 200 North Craig Street in Oakland

-g5aK5xatrz5pJi_7ZohJw.text: Absolutely spectacular food -- awesome crunchy biscuits & gravy, green beans and shoofly pie.  Everything had flavor out the wazoo!  It's a very relaxed atmosphere, small but not cramped.  Only problem was that the waiter was a little slow when it was check time and apparently all the tables have to share sweeteners?  But that's all pretty trivial when the chow is that good.

ISqWd643y-GRIIskKJZQSQ.text: I work right across the street from Pie and went there for the first time. The restaurant is super cute and retro feeling and staff are all very nice. The espresso was delicious and I can't wait to go back to try their pie -- I've heard from coworkers that it's great!

ukB6hAO_U1FEKb2CnVlKnQ.text: The food was good, the service was good.  Pies for breakfast, not so much, 3 pies that were so so.  Have had much better pies in many other locations. Was kind of expensive for amount of food as well, but my major concern was the lack of pie selection and lack of excellence in flavors.

sqgjUCDomvF9y4keZCSktg.text: The food at this location spelled out one idea to me... It was trying too hard. It offered coffee like a sit down coffee joint, and it offered alcohol like a bar... But it seemed like three different locations in one place. While this could work, I felt no balance, and the place itself seemed too small to offer that many services. I sat next to other patrons with about an inch between our tables, and the menu that day said that it was shortened on that specific day. My party ordered two dishes... The biscuits and gravy and a very complex omelette. The omelette was expensive... I believe it was 12 dollars on its own for a small omellete and one piece of their special toast... But the toast was so burnt, all I could taste was the rock hard burnt nature of it. The omelette itself was overwhelming... Grier, an incredibly overpowering pesto, and asparagus... Several unique, and delicious sounding, but overwhelming ingredients. Ultimately, all it tasted like was pesto. It reminded me of these modern, new wave restaurants that feature specialized and crafted recipes. On the other hand, we also ordered the biscuits and gravy... They were so simplistic it was bland. Dense, heavy biscuits in a gravy that was unseasoned or at least underseasoned and the sauce itself was more of a liquid than a thick gravy. To me... After that intense, specialized omelette, I would expect the other dishes to have the same feeling... But the other dish we tasted was immensely unimpressive.

gPFpJvRqBInnr-I5Pl73Yg.text: The food was really good.  The omelet was outstanding and the cookie was also really tasty.  I didn't give them 5 stars because it was loud.  It was packed and sounds really carries in there so it was hard to have a conversation.  I'll be back to try their pie though!

hbOnym_y10NSPB46-xhTDg.text: Best food place to eat breakfast, loved the pancakes. The only real issue I have with the place is noise. Serice was excellent and staff are friendly.
